Batish considered that the excuses that preceded Choucair's decision were "flimsy".
04 Nov 2019, 19:01 by Lebanon 24
The Minister of Economy and Trade in the caretaker government, Mansour Batish, welcomed in a statement, “the response of the Minister of Communications Mohamed Choucair to his repeated requests, especially to the two books dated October 3 and November 1, 2019, obliging Alfa and Touch cell phone companies to pricing and selling Lebanese ID cards. "The excuses that have been delayed in the previous application are flimsy excuses. There is no decree, decision or agreement that exceeds the constitution and the law. The Ministry of Economy and Trade, through Directorate of Protection of Even in such difficult circumstances, the consumer has never been late in carrying out her duty through the tours of her monitors on all markets, following up her situation and underlining the records of the violators. ”He concluded by saying:“ I hope that cooperation will continue between the other ministries and departments for the benefit of citizens and preserve. Their rights. "
